body.name: One Last Secret
body.description: Everyone has secrets, don't they?One last clientA week at a beautiful chateau in the south of France—it should be a straightforward final job for Dora. She's a smart, stunning and discreet escort, and Daniel has paid for her services before. This time, all she has to do is to convince the assembled guests that she is his girlfriend. Dora is used to playing roles and being whatever men want her to be. It's all about putting on a front.One last chanceIt will be a last, luxurious look at how the other half lives before Dora turns her back on the escort world and all its dangers. She has found someone she loves and trusts. With him, she can escape the life she's trapped in. But when Dora arrives at the chateau, it quickly becomes obvious that nothing is what it seems…One last secretDora finds herself face-to-face with a man she has never forgotten, the one man who really knows her. And as old secrets surface, it becomes terrifyingly apparent that one last secret could cost Dora her life…From the Sunday Times number one bestseller Adele Parks comes a blisteringly provocative novel about power, sex, money and revenge. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excellent domestic thriller! Engaging characters and gradually developing backgrounds make this book one not easily solved. My first by Adele Parks; definitely not my last.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Another good book by Adele Parks
reviews.reviewText: Normally, I wouldn’t want to read about an escort, but Adele Parks was the author.It was a go out of the gate.Many twists and turns, even though I caught most of the clues.The ending definitely surprised me.Well done!I recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This novel was super dark. An escort gets caught up in a scheme to service a client one last time on an island. I love thrillers but this one was tough for me to finish. The plot was well-paced. However, it just had dark sexual undertones which were hard for me to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many twists!
reviews.reviewText: I may be a novice reader but I honestly didn’t see all the twists in this book happening! I loved every chapter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book is twisted and a hurricane of surprise... Quick readIt really pulls you in all different directions! Crazy read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Sex Worker Makes One Last Choice
reviews.reviewText: Thirty-one-year-old Dora works as an “escort” as she calls it. She insists that she is safe in her job and that the woman she works for, Elspeth, keeps her that way. In the beginning, she lets us know that doing sex work isn’t about the money for her and that being rich isn’t that important to her. Being valued is. Dora says that “telling it like it is” is a core skill of hers. Because she’s so adamant about what she does and why, it seems as if she’s a combination of naivete and overconfidence.When she’s savagely beaten by a client, it scares her so much that she opts to take her friend Evan’s proposal of marriage. After spending time with him, she finds he’s kind and sweet. She thinks she can love him. But she's out of practice when it comes to having those kinds of feelings. She’s known poverty, and Evan’s independent wealth appeals to her, contradicting her earlier bluster that money isn’t important to her. Dora states that we won’t like her, but she also lets us know that what she is professing is her version of the truth. “We all trade sex for something,” she says. Her bluster often feels as if she’s protesting too much. At other times, it comes off as belonging to a hardened woman. Is Dora a credible narrator?Dora still believes she can handle anything that comes her way. When Evan needs to leave for a week to work in Hong Kong, Dora takes a job she can’t refuse. It doesn’t involve sex, just accompanying a client, Daniel, to a chateau where his friends will gather and she will play his girlfriend. She rationalizes that this is not “sex work.”Once there, Dora is introduced to Daniel's friends who are a mixed lot, and none of them make her feel comfortable. Then she’s introduced to Jonathan who she’s certain is the man who savagely beat her and told her to give up the sex work or the next time would be her last. When she begins to experience frightening physical ailments, she doubts her sanity and wonders what in heaven’s name is happening to her. When she tries to escape, she can’t. Now she knows she shouldn’t have taken this job and these people “aren’t quite right.”The twists and reversals happen with a speed that often tangles the brain. What exactly is this group of people and who is pulling the strings? When Dora’s background comes to light, the layers of craziness multiply, and what we know gets tangled to the point of wondering about everyone involved.The final secret alluded to in the title comes down like a hammer. Parks takes us on an almost surreal ride while accompanying Dora. Often what Parks lays out seems to contradict what she’s previously set up, and just as we believe one thing, Parks reverses course. She does this over and over until she lands a brilliant and unexpected ending.Adele Parks creates a world from the viewpoint of a complex woman who keeps the reader confused at times or judgmental at others. Some of the observations like “...money is power, and I play the game,” and “I guess I am the epitome of inappropriate,” are meant to establish Dora’s attitude toward her work. Parks keeps us confused about her ... and on edge. Why does she do what she does? Is she self-destructive or brilliant? Only the ending will tell us and then let us breathe once more.Thank you to Adele Parks, Harlequin Trade Publishing, and NetGalley for an advanced copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Lots of twists and turns
reviews.reviewText: This started a bit slow for me but then it picked up and it was hard to put down. It is full of unexpected twists and turns. I was especially surprised at the ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining, a bit far fetched.
reviews.reviewText: This one wasn't too bad. There were moments in the middle that were slow and some things were a little fat fetched. Overall it was a decent thriller and there are a bunch of times that I totally wasn't expecting and the ending was well done. I say if you like thrillers, you may want to give this a try!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A well written storyline with twists and turns throughout. It's full of complex characters who are both strong and vulnerable at the same time. The book offers tension in bucket loads with plenty of surprises along the way. It's a really good read.
Couldn’t get past page 99. Awful story and poorly written

It's a light novel, well written although I found some parts a bit redundants.However, the story flows nicely and keeps you curious most of the time, opening a window on a world not many of us spend time to consider.
And then is all brought together in an unbelievable way- it didn’t help that the main character is not admirable or likable and that’s nothing to do with her profession.
